title: GRAP Stage-IV in Gurugram explained: Timings changed, WFH pushed for offices
description: The Deputy Commissioner Gurugram has implemented revised office timings and a work from home advisory in response to deteriorating air quality. The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) has invoked Stage-IV of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) in Delhi-NCR. State Government offices will operate from 09:30 AM to 05:30 PM, municipal offices from 08:30 AM to 04:30 PM, and private offices are advised to allow 50% staff to work remotely until further notice, as posted on X.

title: Indonesia bus crash: Driver loses control, hits barrier; 15 killed
description: At least 15 people died when an inter-province passenger bus veered off a toll road on Java, Indonesia, early Monday. The bus, en route from Jakarta to Yogyakarta with 34 passengers, struck a barrier and overturned. The cause of the crash and the condition of the injured are still being investigated.

title: 'Studied India's success': How can Pakistan's cricket be fixed? Selector reveals blueprint
description: Pakistan's chief selector Aaqib Javed revealed he's studied India's white-ball success to improve Pakistan's cricket structure. He stressed that quality talent, fostered by robust infrastructure and competition, is key to sustained success, not just individual brilliance. Javed expressed optimism about Pakistan's current team, especially with the upcoming T20 World Cup in familiar conditions.

title: CBSE releases important notice on Hub & Spoke School Model; announces orientation programme
description: CBSE has announced an orientation programme for schools under its Hub and Spoke School Model to strengthen collaboration, resource sharing and student well-being. Scheduled for December 26, 2025, in Jaipur, the programme will bring together school leaders and counsellors to improve implementation, coordination and counselling practices. Registration is free, with limited seats.

Anubhav Sinha, known for films like Mulk, Article 15 and Thappad, reflects on his evolution as a filmmaker and the contradictions that shape his worldview. title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection Day 17: Ranveer Singh starrer crosses Rs 550cr mark
description: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has achieved a remarkable Rs 550 crore milestone, dominating its third weekend with record-breaking collections. The film outshone Hollywood's 'Avatar: Fire and Ash' and is on track to become the highest third-week earner, potentially surpassing 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' and 'Chhaava's' domestic hauls.

title: 'Dhoka nahi deta': Mohsin Naqvi asked to appoint ex-Pak skipper as T20 WC mentor - Watch
description: Pakistan's U19 team triumphed over India in the Asia Cup final by a commanding 191 runs. Mentor Sarfaraz Ahmed's presence resonated with fans, leading to an emotional plea for his appointment as T20 World Cup mentor. This victory marks Pakistan's first U19 Asia Cup title in 13 years, with Sameer Minhas starring with 172 runs.

Sarod player forced to flee Bangladesh hiding Indian identity
description: Renowned sarod player Shiraz Ali Khan fled Bangladesh to Kolkata after his concert venue was vandalized.  Hours before his performance, the cultural hub was attacked amid unrest. Khan, whose family has roots in Bangladesh, concealed his Indian identity to safely depart, while his tabla player remains stranded. He vows not to return until artists and cultural spaces are protected.

title: The Jats draw up new power plans
description: Members of the community, who held significant power in north Indian politics for decades, have lost their grip on it over the past few years due to various social, political, and economic factors. Now, they are seeking new alliances among other agrarian communities to revive their influence, evident from recent conferences and panchayats, finds Ashok Kumar

title: India shuts Chittagong visa operations as tensions rise
description: India suspended visa operations in Chittagong following protests sparked by the lynching of a Hindu man for alleged blasphemy. New Delhi slammed attempts to equate protests targeting its facilities with a demonstration outside the Bangladesh High Commission in Delhi, calling them misleading propaganda.

title: Maha local body poll results: Mahayuti sweeps 207 posts; MVA restricted to 44
description: The BJP-led Mahayuti coalition has secured a decisive victory in Maharashtra's civic elections, winning nearly 207 out of 288 council and nagar panchayat president posts. This performance mirrors their assembly election success, with the BJP emerging as the biggest gainer. The results consolidate Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis's position and are seen as a significant win for the ruling alliance.

title: Samantha mobbed at Hyderabad event: Actor faces crowd chaos during public appearance
description: Following a similar incident with Nidhhi Agerwal, Samantha Ruth Prabhu faced overwhelming crowds at a Hyderabad event, struggling to reach her vehicle amidst security. The event highlighted concerns about fan behavior and preparedness of management teams for public appearances.

title: You learn when dealing with contrarian views: Filmmaker Anubhav Sinha
description: Renowned for his bold exploration of religious harmony, caste discrimination, gender equity, and regional conflicts, Anubhav Sinha delves into the changing landscape of cinema, the surge in audience expectations, the power of research and grassroots connection, the urgency of bringing to the fore pressing social issues, and the art of responsible storytelling

title: A model tribal school in Maharashtra battles water scarcity to fight migration
description: The Hiwali school has been seeking solar power and a KT dam or Kolhapur-Type Weir, a low-cost, gravity-based riverbed structure that acts as a small dam or barrage to store post-monsoon river flow for water supply

description: Scrapping electoral bonds has surprisingly boosted BJP's donations, with electoral trusts disbursing over Rs 3,577 crore in 2024-25.  This marks a significant increase, with the party securing 83.6% of all trust contributions.  While corporate donors sought anonymity, the BJP remains the primary beneficiary of this funding route.

The captain's lawyer stated Dewan initiated the confrontation, leading to a physical altercation where Sejwal was also injured. Both parties reportedly signed a voluntary statement not to pursue legal action.

Record! Mandhana becomes first Indian woman to achieve this rare feat
description: Smriti Mandhana made history in the first Women’s T20I against Sri Lanka by becoming the first Indian to score 4,000 T20I runs. She is only the second woman globally after Suzie Bates to achieve this feat and did it faster than anyone. India’s bowlers then restricted Sri Lanka to 121 runs.

Aditya rejected Tamannaah Bhatia for 'Dhurandhar' song 'Shararat'
description: Dhurandhar is a box office sensation, nearing Rs 550 crore. The film's music is a hit, especially the song Shararat. Choreographer Vijay Ganguly revealed Tamannaah Bhatia was initially considered for the song. Director Aditya Dhar wanted to avoid an item song that would distract from the story. The spy thriller continues its impressive run, outperforming major Hollywood releases.

description: MacKenzie Scott has donated over $7.1 billion in 2025 to 186 organizations globally, including universities and environmental nonprofits, marking her largest annual giveaway. This significant philanthropic effort, detailed on her website Yield Giving, continues her focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives, with substantial contributions to institutions like Howard University and the UNCF.

title: Brittany Mahomes silent as Randi shares hope amid Patrick Mahomes recovery
description: Patrick Mahomes’ season-ending knee injury has left the Chiefs in unfamiliar territory. While Brittany Mahomes has remained silent, his mother Randi publicly thanked fans for their prayers and support. As Mahomes begins a lengthy rehabilitation, the Chiefs face a rare playoff miss but remain optimistic about his full recovery and return in 2026.

title: 'Recovery isn’t optional': Why Chiefs Heiress Gracie hunt chose strength in 2025
description: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt reveals she gained 15 lbs during her 2025 fitness journey, explaining why strength, recovery, and long-term health mattered more than appearance. The Kansas City Chiefs owner’s daughter shares how intentional training, muscle gain, and consistency helped her finish the year stronger than she started.

title: Anthony Joshua net worth 2025: Boxing earnings, career and Jake Paul fight payday
description: Anthony Joshua's net worth is estimated at £195 million in 2025, with the majority earned from boxing purses. He also generates significant income from endorsements and property investments. Joshua is set to earn a guaranteed £70 million from his upcoming fight against Jake Paul, a professionally sanctioned eight-round heavyweight bout.
